hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Rotation Catalyst on BTC Breakout Failures
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC fails to sustain a breakout above key resistance ($90K) following positive catalyst (ETF inflows, institutional news), capital rotates disproportionately into mid-cap alts (ETH, SOL, AVAX) within 6-12 hours, generating 4-7% alpha vs. BTC.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Traders anticipating BTC momentum become disappointed on failed breakouts, seeking alpha elsewhere. This triggers rapid rotation into high-beta alts as 'second-best' trade. The catalyst amplifies this rotation pattern beyond typical mean reversion.
entry_conditions: BTC attempts breakout > $90K on positive catalyst (news sentiment > +0.7)
BTC fails to hold breakout, reverses below $89.5K within 4 hours
ETH/BTC ratio begins upward inflection (1-hour change > 0.3%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio gains +3.0% from entry OR 36 hours pass

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Failed BTC breakouts lead to broad market selloff instead of alt rotation (BTC.D increases) in >35% of cases.
